title: U.S. disposable personal income - monthly percentage of change 2019/20
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
The Monthly percentage of change is appeared to be the highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
There is a difference of 0.6 between the maximum Month Jan '20 and minimum Month Oct '19.
min_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Monthly percentage of change in each Month on the y axis.
The maximum Monthly percentage of change 0.6 is found at Month Jan '20 and the minimum is found at Oct '19 where Month is 0.0.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
The Monthly percentage of change is appeared to be the highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
There is a difference of 0.6 between the maximum Month Jan '20 and minimum Month Oct '19.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Monthly percentage of change in the y axis.
The maximum Monthly percentage of change 0.6 is found at Month Jan '20 and the minimum is found at Oct '19 where Month is 0.0.
There is a difference of 0.6 between the maximum Month Jan '20 and minimum Month Oct '19.
Month Jan '20 is higher than any other Months with value 0.6, followed by Aug '19, and Feb '19. Down to Month Oct '19 with the lowest value 0.0.
Overall Monthly percentage of change has lowered over the Months.
Similar Monthly percentage of change is found in Month Nov '19, Jun '19, Apr '19, and Mar '19.
The Month Jan '20 tends to be 1.73 percent higher than average.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 4.5.
